intro: Torenia mildbraedii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Torenia mildbraedii is also valued for its ability to bloom continuously throughout the growing season.
